1 hour
I really enjoyed the series of presenters. There was quite a lot of variety in approaches and topics.

This was a very interesting seminar that introduced me to many new ideas and innovations in the public health world. I enjoyed hearing from all of the guest speakers that shared their work with us and would highly recommend this seminar to anyone who has even the smallest interest in modeling.

Strengths - great modeling concepts and examples of current modeling research 
Weaknesses - would like to explore more chronic disease modeling
Good! Speakers are experts in the field and the topics were very interesting and refreshing!
I love the Modeling Seminars. I have learned a lot from them.
weakness: time conflicts with professional skill training

Professor Patiel is wonderful. His enthusiasm for modeling and public health is infectious and he is an encouraging, kind instructor. Whenever I had a question or concern during the semester I felt very comfortable reaching out to him and he was always prompt and helpful in his response.
Great! Prof. Paltiel is very professional and approachable.
Dr. Paltiel is one of the best instructors at YSPH.
great professor and very supportive
Very accessible and communicative

The modeling seminar is a series of guest lectures from folks doing highly interesting work in the field of public health modeling. Seminars happen once a month so it is very easy to include them in your schedule. Speakers had a diverse array of backgrounds and research interests and I enjoyed learning about so many new topics. If you have even the remotest interest in modeling, take this seminar!
Great seminar if interested in modeling and getting exposure to different areas of research where modeling is utilized.
I would recommend the spring modeling seminar to students interested in infectious diseases and modeling!
Yes, I would recommend the seminar for anyone who wants to learn more about modeling.
recommend. Know more problems can be solved by modeling
interesting topics about modeling
Yes, topics and speakers were novel and very interesting
